contextId.occurrenceNote: They probably could literally sleep, but the writer uses an exaggeration to express how intensely they desire to commit evil actions. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: they cannot sleep until they do evil

contextId.occurrenceNote: The writer speaks of people being unable to sleep as if sleep were an object that someone stole from them. They probably could literally sleep, but the writer uses an exaggeration to express how intensely they desire to commit evil actions. Alternate translation: "they are unable to sleep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
The word "everyone" is an exaggeration. Alternate translation: "it seems that everyone is a friend" or "almost everyone is a friend" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])

Possible meanings of this exaggeration are 1) "be very careful not to eat too much" or 2) "do not eat anything at all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: put a knife to your throat

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration for wishing one had not eaten anything. Alternate translation: "You will wish that you had not eaten anything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: You will vomit up the little you have eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration for doing necessary work that would clearly do him good. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: he has no strength to lift it up to his mouth

contextId.occurrenceNote: "A piece of bread" here is an exaggeration for a very small bribe or reward. Alternate translation: "a man will sin for very little gain" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: for a piece of bread a man will do wrong

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration for doing everything they can to avoid having wicked people harm them. Alternate translation: "people go into hiding" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rpronouns]])

This is probably an exaggeration: she works late into the night, but not from dusk to dawn. Alternate translation: "She burns a lamp through the night as she works" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: all night long her lamp is not extinguished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is probably an exaggeration to show that she is not afraid. Alternate translation: "is not afraid of what will happen in the future" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: laughs at the time to come
